messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] help with tsuba Signiture
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, I wondered about that. Dirk ... From: Jim Gilbert To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, I wondered about that.

Dirk
----- Original Message -----
From: Jim Gilbert<mailto:jggilbert@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com<mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: 04/22/2005 7:23 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] help with tsuba Signiture


Rich,
Your reading is correct. The mei looks OK, there's a similar one illustrated in Wakayama. The date is probably early Edo.

Dirk, if you're going to clean the rust, be very careful. It's easy to damage the inlay. Also, try not to "shine up" the brass.

Jim



Hi Dirk, still having a bit of trouble with some of these kanji but it
looks to me like

Pic1 - Right side, Izumi no Kami
Pic 1 - Left side - Koike Yoshiro
Pc 2 - Naomasa

So, that would make it Yoshiro Zogan if Shoshin and probably late
Muromachi, early Edo.

Izumi no Kami Koike Yoshiro
Naomasa

Look to Nihonto Koza Kodogu page 19-21

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] help with tsuba Signiture
messages.msgSnippet: Rich, Your reading is correct.  The mei looks OK, there s a similar one illustrated in Wakayama.  The date is probably early Edo. Dirk, if you re going to
messages.messageBody:
Rich,
Your reading is correct. The mei looks OK, there's a similar one illustrated in Wakayama. The date is probably early Edo.

Dirk, if you're going to clean the rust, be very careful. It's easy to damage the inlay. Also, try not to "shine up" the brass.

Jim



Hi Dirk, still having a bit of trouble with some of these kanji but it
looks to me like

Pic1 - Right side, Izumi no Kami
Pic 1 - Left side - Koike Yoshiro
Pc 2 - Naomasa

So, that would make it Yoshiro Zogan if Shoshin and probably late
Muromachi, early Edo.

Izumi no Kami Koike Yoshiro
Naomasa

Look to Nihonto Koza Kodogu page 19-21

Rich

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the help.

Dirk
----- Original Message -----
From: bungotakadasword<mailto:MuramasaIII@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com<mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: 04/22/2005 6:32 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: help with tsuba Signiture



I can only read the right side.........
Izumi no kami.
hopefully this will give you some sort of direction as to where to
look further

milt

looks to me like

Pic1 - Right side, Izumi no Kami
Pic 1 - Left side - Koike Yoshiro
Pc 2 - Naomasa

So, that would make it Yoshiro Zogan if Shoshin and probably late
Muromachi, early Edo.

Izumi no Kami Koike Yoshiro
Naomasa

Look to Nihonto Koza Kodogu page 19-21

Rich

Hi Dirk, still having a bit of trouble with some of these kanji but it
looks to me like

Pic1 - Right side, Izumi no Kami
Pic 1 - Left side - Koike Yoshiro
Pc 2 - Naomasa

So, that would make it Yoshiro Zogan if Shoshin and probably late
Muromachi, early Edo.

Izumi no Kami Koike Yoshiro
Naomasa

Look to Nihonto Koza Kodogu page 19-21

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] help with tsuba Signiture
messages.messageBody:
mei 1
http://www.freeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/mei1.jpg<http://www.freeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/mei1.jpg>
mei 2
http://www.freeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/mei2.jpg<http://www.freeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/mei2.jpg>
----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner<mailto:ikkanshi@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com<mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: 04/21/2005 8:26 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] help with tsuba Signiture


Dirk, on your scanner, try propping up one end of the tsuba off the
glass, bu about 1/4 to 1/2 inch, then scan the mei area. The angle helps
reflect light of the chisel strokes and can make the mei easier to read.
Try lifting both ends fo rdifferent results.

Rich



dirk marshall wrote:

>
> Hello,
>
> I purchased this tsuba. it needs cleaning but I was wondering if
> any one could read the mei and tell me what it says. It is signed on
> both sides. I just got it and it is still pretty dirty but the mons
> are nice. Would this be a Yoshiro tsuba?
>
> Tsuba picture 1
>

messages.subject: help with tsuba Signiture
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, I purchased this tsuba.  it needs cleaning but I was wondering if any one could read the mei and tell me what it says.  It is signed on both sides.  I
messages.messageBody:
Hello,

I purchased this tsuba. it needs cleaning but I was wondering if any one could read the mei and tell me what it says. It is signed on both sides. I just got it and it is still pretty dirty but the mons are nice. Would this be a Yoshiro tsuba?

Tsuba picture 1

http://www.freeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/tsuba1.jpg<http://wwwfreeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/tsuba1.jpg>

Tsuba picture 2

http://www.freeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/tsuba2.jpg<http://wwwfreeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/tsuba2.jpg>

thanks
Dirk

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
